tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe It's in the house again this morning. It turns out that sellotaping the windows and doors is futile. I'm guessing it's in your house, too? If so, I'm sorry 😔

@a_merrydew @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe So I’m confused today because the outside of the house is absolutely there with a vengeance but I couldn’t smell it inside. I have the sore throat and bad chest but assumed that was from the last 2 days. Now wondering am I becoming desensitised to it?! @StinkStopthe

Peat has been used in compost for many years. 
Sadly draining of peatlands:
🙁 Degrades this amazing habitat
🙁 Releases carbon into the atmosphere 
 
It doesn't need to be this way! Demand the Government bans peat sales today! 👇
https://t.co/W1yGN2JakN #peatfreeapril https://t.co/eLptoKEHJS
#StopTheStink @BorisJohnson @MattHancock @AaronBell4NUL  @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/titjK1mwhJ

tweets.text: It’s going to be awful in summer if @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock @PHE_EoEngland don’t do something very quickly. Imagine not being able to open windows or go outside in the middle of summer? Help us please @StinkStopthe https://t.co/Y1xicOYOp0

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Hit the nail on the head 👍 It's much more than a nuisance odour. It's causing serious stress, sleep deprivation, issues with breathing, migraine, sickness, and so on. I've read some scientific articles and the long-term effects of regular exposure to landfill gasses is scary 😔

Much more than a nuisance odour (although that’s bad enough)- a thick dense gas invading homes frequently & causing health effects & great distress to the community . The @EnvAgency should be held to account for their ineffective regulation of the perpetrators  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/CdTG3E03c9

tweets.text:
At Health Questions I asked @MattHancock about the public health implications of the breaches at Walley's Quarry.

I know, from both the local GPs and those writing to me, that many residents are concerned for their health, both physically and mentally. @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/pwh6zUI4Zs

tweets.text: Thank you @ITVCentral for spreading the news about the outrage that is #Walleysquarrey in NUL The local community have such care for eachother while the @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency offer little hope @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off #stopthestink

@AaronBell4NUL @MattHancock @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids It is a disgrace what so many are being forced to 'live' (exist) with. A community forced to provide air purifiers for each other so that the vulnerable can be a little better is so wrong! It really is beyond belief and something needs to happen. Come on @MattHancock get involved

tweets.text:
Today at PMQs, I raised the issue of partially treated sewage being released into the River Chess and other rivers and chalk streams.

The Prime Minister confirmed his commitment to resolving this issue, having set up the Storm Overflows Taskforce. https://t.co/sFfHzQVqWP

tweets.text:
If you're heading to the #beach today please remember to take your #litter home with you.

Don't leave rubbish next to a full bin. Litter can easily get blown or washed into the sea and pollute our waters.

#BinIt4Beaches #LoveWater #UKHeatwave https://t.co/XUnmuYad4k

tweets.text: On the infamous big weekend stink of @RedIndustries2 Walley’s Quarry,the @EnvAgencyMids received thousands of complaints to their emergency number. No one came out and no data was collected.That tells you everything you need to know about the effectiveness of the EA.#stopthestink https://t.co/Tc3t6CrWb9
How far can we go @UniofOxford @Cambridge_Uni

No action. If it rains or @thameswater chuck sewage down the pipe whatever this is will contaminate the Lea where Kingfishers are actively nesting. I have reported. Please help and report to EA hotline. What3words ref is second.inspector.stale
@Feargal_Sharkey  retweet may help. https://t.co/z73mmhX74m
When a milk tanker overturns in the river #llanwrda #wales #milk https://t.co/vnyhr5FXBi

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @OldDorset @EnvAgency I watched this because you’d tweeted about it. Fortunately live upstream of any sewage processing plants now but notice farmers pumping slurry in now

tweets.text: @HMUG_Hackney @StonebridgeLock @SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust I believe it flows under the marsh to the point I pinned, I watched to EA workers trace the stream about a month or 2 ago. All assumptions but it seems to be right to me

A warm welcome for ground nesting birds on a Perthshire grouse moor.

It is a disgrace that grouse moors keep muirburning into the breeding season. 

What climate crisis? https://t.co/XQravM8VAm

Thank you for raising this Aaron. Both @PHE_uk and @EnvAgencyMids need to have more urgency in their effort and actions to stop the stink and to reassure local people re health  implications. https://t.co/T2B2okOHA8
